title: Sri Lanka rejects all bonds at auction amid rupee fall
body_lines: ECONOMYNEXT – Sri Lanka has rejected all bids at a bond auction on Tuesday where 45 billion rupees in bonds were offered.
The debt office offered 25 billion rupees in 15.03.2025 bonds and 20 billion rupees in 01.05.2029 bonds.
During past currency crises, the debt office has rejected bids but later sold bonds at higher yields.
There is an estimated 18 billion rupees of coupons to be paid on April 01.  If the money is printed more liquidity will be added to the banking system.
Sri Lanka’s rupee has fallen steeply over the past three weeks from 203 to below 300 to the US dollar as an attempt was made to float the rupee with a surrender requirement in place.
However economists and analysts have warned that surrender requirement would prevent a float from getting established, and policy rates also have to be hiked. (Colombo/Mar30/2022)
